{"step_by_step_thinking": "Enameloma, also known as enamel pearl, is a small, round, enamel-covered mass that is usually found on the root of a tooth. It is formed due to the misplacement of ameloblasts, the cells that produce enamel, during tooth development. It is not a true neoplasm of ameloblasts, nor is it a tumor resembling enamel present on the gingiva. It is also not a tumor of ameloblasts which fail to differentiate terminally.", "answer_choice": "A"}
